meanings.definition: A band of material worn around the neck.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful necklace with a sparkling collar.
meanings.sent2: The dog's collar had his name and phone number on it.
meanings.sent3: The collar matched perfectly with her dress, making her look elegant.
meanings.sent4: The collar of the shirt stood out with its intricate lace design.
meanings.sent5: The collar felt snug but comfortable around his neck.

meanings.sent1: The police officer collars the thief before he could escape.
meanings.sent2: He collars the suspect as soon as he steps out of the building.
meanings.sent3: The detective collars the criminal in a dramatic chase scene.
meanings.sent4: She collars the shoplifter just as he tries to leave the store.
meanings.sent5: The security guard collars the troublemaker swiftly and efficiently.

meanings.sent1: She collars her excitement when she sees the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: He collars his temper before it gets out of control.
meanings.sent3: The teacher collars the noisy students with a stern look.
meanings.sent4: He collars his fear and bravely faces the challenge.
meanings.sent5: She collars her laughter during the serious meeting.

meanings.definition: To put a collar on an animal.
meanings.sent1: The farmer collars the sheep before letting them out to graze.
meanings.sent2: She collars the cat before it runs outside.
meanings.sent3: The vet collars the puppy with a colorful collar.
meanings.sent4: He collars the horse gently to make sure it fits properly.
meanings.sent5: She collars the parrot with a shiny new collar.
